act_pit.actname: New West Partnership Trade Agreement Implementation Act

change.changenote: Section 4 BEFORE repealed by 2011-3-4, effective June 30, 2012 [retro from June 2, 2011 (Royal Assent)].

subsection.subsectiontext: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations for the purposes of implementing the Agreement or the amendments made by this Act to other Acts, including, without limiting this, to remedy any transitional difficulties encountered in implementing the Agreement or amendments made by this Act to other Acts.
A regulation made under this section may be made retroactive to a date not earlier than July 1, 2010, and if made retroactive

paragraph.paragraphtext: is deemed to come into force on the date specified in the regulation, and
is retroactive to the extent necessary to give it force and effect on the date specified in the regulation.

subsection.subsectiontext: This section is repealed two years after it is brought into force and on its repeal any regulations made under it are also repealed.
